sen.j: 慶長大判（けいちょうおおばん）とは江戸時代の初期すなわち慶長6年（1601年）より発行された大判であり、墨書、金品位および発行時期などにより数種類に細分類される。
sen.e: Keicho Oban is a large-sized old Japanese gold coin issued in the early period of the Edo period namely in Keicho 6 (1601) and is to be classified into several varieties according to the mint master's name and his signature, karat (gold measurement), time issued, and so on.
sen.cmt: 「慶長小判」と「慶長丁銀」が重複して記入されています。 ウィキピデアの「慶長大判」の記事を参照し、重複部分は省いて訳しました。
sen.e: Keicho Oban is a large-sized old Japanese gold coin issued in the early Edo period, from 1601 more specifically, and this can be classified into several varieties according to writings in ink, karat (gold measurement), timing of issuance, and so on.
sen.cmt: 「江戸時代の初期すなわち」の箇所を修正、元号を削除、「墨書」「発行時期」の訳語の修正しました。
sen.e: Keicho Oban is a large-sized old Japanese gold coin issued in the early Edo period, from 1601 more specifically, and this can be classified into several varieties according to writings in ink, karat (gold measurement), timing of issuance, and so on.

sen.j: この発行年については慶長の幣制の成立と同時期とされるが詳細については不明であり、定かでない。
sen.e: It is said that the Keicho Oban is issued at the same time when the currency system of the Keicho era was established; however, the detail is not known and it is not yet laid out as a reliable fact.
It is said that Keicho Oban was issued at the same time that the currency system of the Keicho era was established; however, its details are unknown and it is not yet laid out as a reliable fact.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の修正、detailを複数形に修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that Keicho Oban was issued at the same time that the currency system of the Keicho era was established; however, its details are unknown and it is not yet laid out as a reliable fact.

sen.j: 慶長大判、慶長小判および慶長小判慶長一分判、慶長丁銀および慶長丁銀慶長豆板銀を総称して慶長金銀（けいちょうきんぎん）と呼び、徳川家康による天下統一を象徴する貨幣として位置付けられる。
sen.e: Keicho Oban, Keicho Koban, Keicho Ichibuban, Keicho Cho-gin, and Keicho Mameita-gin are generically called Keicho Kingin (gold and silver of the Keicho era) and they are positioned as currency which symbolize the unification of Japan by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

Keicho Oban, Keicho Koban (small-sized coin), Keicho Ichibuban, Keicho Cho-gin, and Keicho Mameita-gin are generically called Keicho Kingin (gold and silver of the Keicho era) and they are positioned as symbolic currencies of the unification of the whole country achieved by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 「徳川家康による天下統一を象徴する貨幣」の箇所を修正しました。
sen.e: Keicho Oban, Keicho Koban (small-sized coin), Keicho Ichibuban, Keicho Cho-gin, and Keicho Mameita-gin are generically called Keicho Kingin (gold and silver of the Keicho era) and they are positioned as symbolic currencies of the unification of the whole country achieved by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 表面は「拾両後藤（花押）」と墨書され、後藤五代徳乗、その実弟長乗、七代顕乗、九代程乗の書である。
sen.e: On the surface of Keicho Oban, 'Ju-ryo Goto' (Kao [a seal mark of the mint master written in Indian ink]) is seen; the seal mark was written by Tokujo GOTO, the fifth generation mint master of the mint master Shirobee GOTO, Tokujo's own younger brother Chojo, Kenjo, the seventh generation mint master, and Teijo, the ninth generation of the mint master; the one written by Chojo in his early days is reminiscent of a bamboo leaf that Keicho Oban with the seal mark of Chojo in his early days are called Sasagaki Oban.

The surface of Keicho Oban had a writing in ink of 'Ju-ryo Goto' (a kao [written seal mark]), and this seal mark was written by Tokujo GOTO, who was the fifth generation of the Goro family, Tokujo's real younger brother Chojo, Kenjo, who was the seventh generation of the Goto family, and Teijo, the ninth generation of the family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。全体的に書き換えました。
sen.e: The surface of Keicho Oban had a writing in ink of 'Ju-ryo Goto' (a kao [written seal mark]), and this seal mark was written by Tokujo GOTO, who was the fifth generation of the Goro family, Tokujo's real younger brother Chojo, Kenjo, who was the seventh generation of the Goto family, and Teijo, the ninth generation of the family.

sen.j: 初期の長乗によるものは花押が笹の葉を髣髴させ笹書大判（ささがきおおばん）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The kao written by Chojo in his early days is reminiscent of a bamboo leaf, and Keicho Oban with his seal mark are called Sasagaki (which literally means "bamboo leaf writing") Oban.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。余分な語句の削除、「笹書」の字義を追加しました。
sen.e: The kao written by Chojo in his early days is reminiscent of a bamboo leaf, and Keicho Oban with his seal mark are called Sasagaki (which literally means "bamboo leaf writing") Oban.

sen.j: 表面は上下左右に丸枠桐紋極印がそれぞれ一箇所、計四箇所打たれ、裏面中央に丸枠桐紋、亀甲桐紋、花押の極印が打たれ、形状は角ばった楕円形である。
sen.e: The hallmarks of paulownia patterns in a circle are carved on the left, right, top and bottom of the Keicho Oban and the hallmarks of paulownia patterns in a circle, a pattern of paulownia in a hexagon, and Kao are carved on the back; the shape is angular ellipse

Four circled hallmarks of paulownia patterns are carved on the left, right, top and bottom of a Keicho Oban coin and a circled hallmark of paulownia patterns, a pattern of paulownia in a hexagon, and a kao are carved on its back, and the shape of a coin is angular ellipse.
sen.cmt: 「四箇所」が抜けていたので主語として挿入、冠詞の修正を行いました
sen.e: Four circled hallmarks of paulownia patterns are carved on the left, right, top and bottom of a Keicho Oban coin and a circled hallmark of paulownia patterns, a pattern of paulownia in a hexagon, and a kao are carved on its back, and the shape of a coin is angular ellipse.

sen.j: 表面は天正大判と異なり鏨目（たがねめ）に変化している。
sen.e: Differing from the Tensho Oban, the surface of the Keicho Oban has small dots carved on its entirety leaving no space between.
Unlike Tensho Oban, small dots are carved on the surface of Keicho Oban
sen.cmt: 「異なり」の訳語の変更、語順の変更しました。
sen.e: Unlike Tensho Oban, small dots are carved on the surface of Keicho Oban

sen.j: 慶長大判の総鋳造量は16,565枚という記録もあるが明暦判でも15,080枚であることから、この記録がどこまでの範囲を示すものかは不明である。
sen.e: According to a record, the total amount of Keicho Oban minted is 16,565; however, even Meirekiban has a record of 15,080 as the total that it is not clear in terms of the range the record covers for counting.

According to some record, the total amount of Keicho Oban minted is 16,565; however, as 15,080 Meirekiban (Keicho Ogan minted during the Meireki era) were minted, it is not clear what range does this record cover.
sen.cmt: however以降を書き換えました。
sen.e: According to some record, the total amount of Keicho Oban minted is 16,565; however, as 15,080 Meirekiban (Keicho Ogan minted during the Meireki era) were minted, it is not clear what range does this record cover.

sen.j: 大判は一般流通を前提とした通貨ではなく、恩賞および贈答用のものであった。
sen.e: Oban was not a currency minted on the assumption that it is to be used for regular circulation; it is for rewards and gifts; in case such a coin drifts to the currency market, the cost is determined at an exchanger in which the price is determined based on the gold content and the demand for the coin rather than the face value; in terms of Keicho Koban and Ichibuban, the price was roughly 7 ryo 2 bu when the price was determined based on the gold content; in the early period of Keicho era, the market price of Keicho Koban and Ichibuban were 8 ryo 2 bu as a coin used for rewards and gifts.
Oban was not a currency minted to be used for regular circulation, and it was for rewards and gifts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました時制の修正しました。
sen.e: Oban was not a currency minted to be used for regular circulation, and it was for rewards and gifts.

sen.j: 、市場に流れた場合は両替商において含有金量および需要に基づいて価格が決められ、慶長小判、一分判に対し含有金量に基づけば大凡、七両二分であるが初期の慶長年間は道具値段として八両二分が相場であった。
sen.e: In case such a coin drifted to the currency market, its value was determined at an exchange shop according to the amount of contained gold and demand for the coin, and as for Keicho Koban and Ichibuban, their value was approximately 7 ryo 2 bu according to their gold content but in the early Keicho era, the market price of Keicho Koban and Ichibuban was 8 ryo 2 bu as a coin used for rewards and gifts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました全体的に書き換えました
sen.e: In case such a coin drifted to the currency market, its value was determined at an exchange shop according to the amount of contained gold and demand for the coin, and as for Keicho Koban and Ichibuban, their value was approximately 7 ryo 2 bu according to their gold content but in the early Keicho era, the market price of Keicho Koban and Ichibuban was 8 ryo 2 bu as a coin used for rewards and gifts.

sen.j: また墨書が消えた場合、大判座へ持ち込み、銀三匁五分、文政2年（1819年）以降は金一分の手数料で書改めを受けた。
sen.e: In addition, when the mint master's seal mark faded away, people brought it to Obanza (place to mint Oban) and the writing in Indian ink could be rewritten with the fee of 3 monme 5 bu of silver; after 1819 this fee became 1 bu of gold.

In addition, when a coin's seal mark written in ink faded away, people brought it to an obanza (place to mint Oban) and the writing in Indian ink could be rewritten with the fee of three monme and five bu of silver, or one bu of gold after 1819.
sen.cmt: 「墨書」の訳語の変更、冠詞の修正、不要なセミコロンの削除およびそれに伴う語句の変更しました。
sen.e: In addition, when a coin's seal mark written in ink faded away, people brought it to an obanza (place to mint Oban) and the writing in Indian ink could be rewritten with the fee of three monme and five bu of silver, or one bu of gold after 1819.

sen.j: 小判および分金が生粋金（純金）および花降銀（純銀）の合金で銅は不純物程度でしか含まれないのに対し、大判では3%程度の銅が意図的に加えられ、黄金色を演出させ審美性を持たせているとされる。
sen.e: Koban and Bukin are mixed metal of pure gold and pure silver and the copper content is only to some degree of impurities; whereas, in terms of Oban about 3% of copper is intentionally added to add the color of gold and to make it more aesthetic.

Koban and Bukin were made of mixed metal of pure gold and pure silver, and the amount of contained copper was at impurity level; whereas, about 3% of copper were intentionally added to Oban in order to have the color of gold to make it more aesthetic.
sen.cmt: 時制の修正、「不純物程度」「意図的に加えられ」等の語句の変更しました。
sen.e: Koban and Bukin were made of mixed metal of pure gold and pure silver, and the amount of contained copper was at impurity level; whereas, about 3% of copper were intentionally added to Oban in order to have the color of gold to make it more aesthetic.

sen.j: 質量は金一枚（京目拾両）すなわち四十四匁を基準としているが、実際には吹き減りおよび磨耗などを考慮し二分の入り目が加えられ、四十四匁二分が規定量目である。
sen.e: The standard of the weight is 165 g namely 44 monme; however, the actual standard is 44 monme 2 bu with the added 2 bu as the decrease in the weight at the time of minting and wear are considered.

The standard weight was one plate of gold (165 grams), which was equivalent to 44 monme; however, the actual standard weight was 44 monme and 2 bu with additional 2 bu as decrease in the weight at the time of minting and abrasion were taken into consideration.
sen.cmt: 冗長な語句の修正、冠詞の修正、「金一枚」が抜けていたので追加しました。
sen.e: The standard weight was one plate of gold (165 grams), which was equivalent to 44 monme; however, the actual standard weight was 44 monme and 2 bu with additional 2 bu as decrease in the weight at the time of minting and abrasion were taken into consideration.

sen.j: 通用期間は元禄大判通用開始の元禄8年（1695年）までであった。
sen.e: The period Keicho Oban was in currency was up to Genroku 8 (1695) from which Genroku Oban was started to be used.
Keicho Oban was in currency was used until 1695, when Genroku Oban started to be used.
sen.cmt: 全体的に書き換えました
sen.e: Keicho Oban was in currency was used until 1695, when Genroku Oban started to be used.

sen.j: 大判座は当初、京都の室町通の北端に設けられ、寛永2年（1625年）以降は江戸にも大判座が開設された。
sen.e: At first Obanza was established at the northern end of Muromachi Dori in Kyoto; After 1625 Obanza was also opened in Edo; Oban minted during the period from Keicho era to Meireki era there exist the following Oban and it is said that each coin is more or less different in its karat.
At first an obanza was established at the northern end of Muromachi-dori Street in Kyoto, and after 1625, obanza were also opened in Edo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました。不要な大文字の削除、不要なセミコロンの削除しました。
sen.e: At first an obanza was established at the northern end of Muromachi-dori Street in Kyoto, and after 1625, obanza were also opened in Edo.

sen.j: 慶長年間から明暦年間までの鋳造のものには以下のものがあり、それぞれ多少の金品位の違いがあるといわれる。
sen.e: Types of oban minted from the Keicho era to the Meireki era are as follows and it is said that each coin is more or less different in its karat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました「慶長年間から明暦年間までの鋳造のものには以下のものがあり」の箇所を書き換えしました。
sen.e: Types of oban minted from the Keicho era to the Meireki era are as follows and it is said that each coin is more or less different in its karat.

sen.j: 拾両判（じゅうりょうばん）：
sen.e: Ju-ryo Ban
Ju-ryo Ban
Ju-ryo Ban

sen.j: 二条判（にじょうばん）：
sen.e: Nijo Ban
Nijo Ban
Nijo Ban

sen.j: 一ツ極印（ひとつごくいん）：裏面に「田」、「ま」、「金」、「さ」、「孫」の極印のいずれかが一つ打たれている。
sen.e: On the back side one hallmark is carved and the hallmark is one of the following characters: "田" (ta), "ま" (ma), "金" (kin), "さ" (孫).
Hitotsugoku-in: On the back side one hallmark is carved and the hallmark is one of the following characters: "田" (ta), "ま" (ma), "金" (kin), and "さ" (孫).
sen.cmt: 「一ツ極印」が抜けているので追加しました。
sen.e: Hitotsugoku-in: On the back side one hallmark is carved and the hallmark is one of the following characters: "田" (ta), "ま" (ma), "金" (kin), and "さ" (孫).

sen.j: サマ判（さまばん）：裏面に「サ・マ」と二文字の極印が打たれている。
sen.e: Sama Ban: On the back side, hallmark of two characters 'サマ・マ' (sa and ma) is carved.
Sama Ban: On the back side, two hallmarks of characters 'サ and マ' (sa and ma) are carved.
sen.cmt: 「'サマ・マ'」という表記がおかしいので修正。「二文字の極印」の箇所の訳文を変更
sen.e: Sama Ban: On the back side, two hallmarks of characters 'サ and マ' (sa and ma) are carved.

sen.j: 次判（なみばん）：裏面に「ゑ・九」、「さ・新」、「長・新」の極印のいずれかが打たれている。
sen.e: Nami Ban: On the back side, a hallmark of two-character combination selected from the following is carved: 'ゑ・九' (e and nine), 'さ・新' (sa and shin), '長・新' (cho and shin).
Nami Ban: On the back side, a hallmark of a combination of two characters selected from the following is carved: 'ゑ・九' (e and nine), 'さ・新' (sa and shin), and '長・新' (cho and shin).
sen.cmt: 「a hallmark of two-character combination」を書き換えしました。
sen.e: Nami Ban: On the back side, a hallmark of a combination of two characters selected from the following is carved: 'ゑ・九' (e and nine), 'さ・新' (sa and shin), and '長・新' (cho and shin).

sen.j: 明暦3年（1657年）の明暦の大火による被害は江戸城の天守閣および御金蔵まで及び、鎔け流れた金銀を明暦4年（1658年）より万治3年（1660年）に掛けて江戸城三の丸で吹き直し鋳造された大判が明暦大判（めいれきおおばん）と呼ばれるが、慶長大判の一種として扱われる。
sen.e: The scale of the Great Fire of the Meireki 3 (1657) was so huge that even the castle tower of the Edo-jo Castle and the Treasury were not able to escape from the injury caused by the fire; from Meireki 4 (1658) to Manji 3 (1660) the large gold coins (Oban) were reminted at the Sannomaru (the third compound) of the Castle using the melted gold and silver because of this fire and these coins are called Meireki Oban and they are treated as a variety of Keicho Oban.
The scale of the Great Fire of Meireki occurred in 1657 was so huge that even the castle tower of Edo-jo Castle and Gokinzo (treasure house of Edo-jo Castle) were also damaged.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処としました
sen.e: The scale of the Great Fire of Meireki occurred in 1657 was so huge that even the castle tower of Edo-jo Castle and Gokinzo (treasure house of Edo-jo Castle) were also damaged.

sen.j: 形状はやや撫肩のものとなり、鏨目は粗くなり、やや右肩上がりの方向に打たれたものが多い。
sen.e: The shape became less angular and the dots carved by chisel became coarser and the direction of the dots in many coins in this variety was not even but carved toward the top corner of the coin making a gradual slope.
Its shape became less angular, and additionally, dots carved by chisel became coarser and they sloped from right to left.
sen.cmt: 冗長な箇所を書き換えしました。
sen.e: Its shape became less angular, and additionally, dots carved by chisel became coarser and they sloped from right to left.

sen.j: その後、京都の大判座でも大判が鋳造された。
sen.e: Afterwards Oban was also minted in Obanza in Kyoto.
Afterwards, Oban was also minted in the obanza in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 不要な大文字を小文字に
sen.e: Afterwards, Oban was also minted in the obanza in Kyoto.

sen.j: 墨書きはいずれも九代程乗のものである。
sen.e: Every Oban of this variety had the seal mark written in Indian ink by the 9th master Teijo who was the descendant of the mint master Shirobee GOTO.
Every Oban of this variety had the seal mark written in Indian ink by the 9th master Teijo.
sen.cmt: 程乗は既出なので説明は削除しました。
sen.e: Every Oban of this variety had the seal mark written in Indian ink by the 9th master Teijo.

sen.j: 明暦判（めいれきばん）もしくは江戸判（えどばん）：裏面に「久・七・新」または「九・七・竹」の極印が打たれ、現存数は慶長大判の中ではこの明暦判が最も多い。
sen.e: On the back side, the hallmark of '久・七・新' (kyu, 7, shin) or '九・七・竹' (9, 7, take) is carved; out of Keicho Oban, the one most numerous in number is this variety.

Meirekiban (also referred to as Edoban): On the back side, the hallmark of '久・七・新' (kyu, seven, shin) or '九・七・竹' (nine, seven, take) is carved, and this Meirekiban has the bigger number of existing coins than any other Keicho Oban types.
sen.cmt: 「明暦判（めいれきばん）もしくは江戸判（えどばん）」が抜けていたので追加、後半書き換えました。
sen.e: Meirekiban (also referred to as Edoban): On the back side, the hallmark of '久・七・新' (kyu, seven, shin) or '九・七・竹' (nine, seven, take) is carved, and this Meirekiban has the bigger number of existing coins than any other Keicho Oban types.

sen.j: 三ツ極印（みつごくいん）：京都の大判座で明暦年間以降に鋳造。
sen.e: Mitsugokuin: This variety is minted in Obanza in Kyoto after Meireki era.
Mitsugokuin: This variety was minted at the obanza in Kyoto in and after the Meireki era.
sen.cmt: 時制の修正、前置詞の修正、「以降」の訳の訂正、冠詞の修正しました。
sen.e: Mitsugokuin: This variety was minted at the obanza in Kyoto in and after the Meireki era.

sen.j: 裏面に「弥・七・九」、「次・七・九」、「坂・七・九」、「弥・七・新」のいずれかの極印が打たれている。
sen.e: On the back side, a hallmark consisting of three characters is carved and the hallmark is one of the following four combinations: '弥・七・九' (ya, 7, 9), '次・七・九' (nami, 7, 9), '坂・七・九' (saka, 7, 9), '弥・七・新' (ya, 7, shin).

On the back side, a hallmark consisting of three characters is carved and the hallmark is one of the following four combinations: '弥・七・九' (ya, seven, nine), '次・七・九' (nami, seven, nine), '坂・七・九' (saka, seven, nine), and '弥・七・新' (ya, seven, shin).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました
sen.e: On the back side, a hallmark consisting of three characters is carved and the hallmark is one of the following four combinations: '弥・七・九' (ya, seven, nine), '次・七・九' (nami, seven, nine), '坂・七・九' (saka, seven, nine), and '弥・七・新' (ya, seven, shin).

sen.j: 四ツ極印（よつごくいん）：京都の大判座で明暦年間以降に鋳造。
sen.e: Yotsugokuin: This variety is minted in Obanza in Kyoto after Meireki era.
Yotsugokuin: This variety was minted at the obanza in Kyoto in and after the Meireki era.
sen.cmt: 時制の修正、前置詞の修正、「以降」の訳の訂正、冠詞の修正しました。
sen.e: Yotsugokuin: This variety was minted at the obanza in Kyoto in and after the Meireki era.

sen.j: 裏面に「次・七・源・九」、「坂・七・源・九」、「弥・七・源・九」のいずれかの極印が打たれている。
sen.e: On the back side, a hallmark consisting of four characters is carved and the hallmark is one of the following three combinations: '次・七・源・九' (nami, 7, gen, 9), '坂・七・源・九' (saka, 7, gen, 9), '弥・七・源・九' (ya, 7, gen, 9).

On the back side, a hallmark consisting of four characters is carved and the hallmark is one of the following three combinations: '次・七・源・九' (nami, seven, gen, nine), '坂・七・源・九' (saka, seven, gen, nine), '弥・七・源・九' (ya, seven, gen, nine).
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました
sen.e: On the back side, a hallmark consisting of four characters is carved and the hallmark is one of the following three combinations: '次・七・源・九' (nami, seven, gen, nine), '坂・七・源・九' (saka, seven, gen, nine), '弥・七・源・九' (ya, seven, gen, nine).
